byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from New York.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH

abstract: FBI director says attacker in May 2015 shooting in Garland, Texas, communicated with comrade using encrypted texts; claim fuels debate over whether technology companies should provide law enforcement with keys to encrypted conversations.
lead_paragraph: James B. Comey told senators that one of the attackers in a recent shooting in Garland, Tex., “exchanged 109 messages with an overseas terrorist” that investigators could not read.

headline.main: F.B.I. Chief Says Texas Gunman Used Encryption to Text Overseas Terrorist
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Chief Says Gunman Used Encryption to Text Terrorist

snippet: James B. Comey told senators that one of the attackers in a recent shooting in Garland, Tex., “exchanged 109 messages with an overseas terrorist” that investigators could not read.
